intro: Ulmus glabra var. vegeta, commonly known as the European wych elm, is a variant of the wych elm native to parts of Europe. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by small, round fruits called samaras. It is often found in moist, fertile soils along riverbanks and in woodland areas. Due to its historical significance and ornamental value, it has been cultivated in various regions for centuries.
